The car park has a capacity of approximately 15 vehicles, so finding a space for a motorhome can be difficult if it is full. It is a beach of blonde sand (only in the summer months, since in winter the sea washes it away), with lifeguards and a restaurant with a terrace.

description: Quiet car park just at the park start. We stayed here very nice, but no room for 'camping'. No service. Nice view of dunes, lighthouse and beach.

title: (35650) La Oliva - 89 Calle Majanicho
description: Very quiet area to sleep, next to a fishing village

title: (35650) La Oliva - Unnamed Road
description: Several spaces along the track. A sign prohibits camping at the start of the trail, but it seems that this only concerns caravans and tents. Lots of van and motorhome spend the night in the area with no problem and the view is magnificent.

title: (35650) La Oliva - Unnamed Road
description: Beach end, sand, easy access, no service, ideal for resting and enjoying the sea

title: (35650) Majanicho - C. Majanicho
description: It is a beautiful place, views of the mountains and the sea

title: (35660) Corralejo -
description: Absolute tranquility and right on the coast. Fantastic view to Lanzarote. Space for two campers. Several small parking lots in this area. No problem even with a large mobile home.

title: (35650) La Oliva - Unnamed Road
description: In full nature, practically in the sand. Without services, but with many caravans and quiet atmosphere. Rocky beach but a little further east you can see a large area of sandy beach.

title: (35650) La Oliva - Unnamed Road
description: Campsite without service but ideal for spending a few nights.

title: (35660) La Oliva - Unnamed Road
description: Overnight next to popcorn beach north of Corralejo, quiet place, at the edge of the beach and pleasant.

title: (35660) Corralejo -
description: It is a small pitch with a maximum of 2/3 places, very quiet and at night you can hear the sound of the sea. Parking is at part of the road that comes to the beach

title: (35628) Pájara - 38-58 Calle Verodes
description: Shaded parking, sheltered from the wind, located behind the town hall and the superb Aztec art church. A drinking water tap on the parking lot.

title: () Pájara - Camino Pájara
description: Beautiful cove (Gallet beach) facing west for the sunset. That's wonderful. It is accessed by a dirt road from the road to Ajuy. It's nature ! No toilet or shower just the sound of the waves! We love :)

title: (35628) Ajuy - 1 Calle el Tabloncillo
description: Large gravel place right on the beach and at the entrance to the woods.

title: (35629) Las Playitas - Barranco del Roque
description: Before going up to the lighthouse you have to go down a small path which is located in the bed of the river. Preferably in the dry season. This is the way to access the lost beach "playa del Roque". No service but really quiet place...

title: (35629) Tuineje - 2 Lugar Faro de la Entallada
title_short: (35629) Tuineje - 2 Lugar Faro de la Entallada
description: You can have views of the sea and the landscaped lighthouse. Parking is free all year round.

title: (35629) Las Playitas -
description: Beautiful location in the middle of nature right by the sea, you are usually alone here enjoying the peace and the rushing waves.

title: (35629) Las Playitas - Calle Tamarco
description: Very cozy little town, perfect for fishing and resting. Showers and bath on the beach. With supermarket and some store.

title: (35629) Tuineje - 1 Lugar Angurria
description: Public parking used by the workers of the nearby hotel, with passage to go to the beach, in the evening the parking is empty, you can also park along the road in front of the golf courses, 1 km from the town passing the seafront

title: (35629) Tesejerague - 24 Caserio Tesejerague
description: Large parking lot under the palm trees of the Church (to see) and cultural center, picnic area and children's games

title: (35620) Gran Tarajal - 16 Avenida de la Constitución
title_short: (35620) Gran Tarajal - 16 Avenida de la Constitución
description: Service station with the possibility of loading non-potable water.

title: (35620) Gran Tarajal - 19 Calle Vigan
description: Free parking area of sand, quite level and close to the center and the promenade, quite quiet area since there is no road nearby, nearby restaurant area, laundry and supermarkets. It is an autochthonous town and very different from the rest of Fuerteventura, it is worth it since it is different, with a black sand beach and a lot of local people and little tourism.

title: (35620) Gran Tarajal - 17 Calle los Sabandeños
description: Drainage of grey water at the grid drain on the ground, NO black water drain! Please leave the area clean! No water available!

name: Speed Queen
title: (35620) Speed Queen
description: Great Laundromat! You can pay with VISA. Everything super clean. Large machines and dryers. Washing takes 30 - 40 minutes (40°C). Dryer on the highest level dries 14 kg of laundry in 30 minutes. Excellent! Opposite is a large parking lot, where you can park meanwhile and shop, for example, in the supermarket around the corner.

title: (35620) Gran Tarajal - 25A Polígono 11
description: Quiet place to be with your ac and enjoy all the services that the place has

title: (35620) Tuineje - 26 Avenida del Aceitún
description: Camping allowed, in front of the see, nearest the port. protected by the wind when come from the  north. nice town and beautified black sand beach just in front of the restaurant in town.

title: (35620) Tuineje - 1 Lugar el Aceitun ME01
description: The local toilets and showers of the (marina) port are serviceable.

title: (35629) Tuineje - 55 Lugar Tarajalejo
description: Loading water to the supplyer.

title: (35629) Giniginamar - 28 Carretera Giniginamar
description: A waste ground very close to public toilets, a clean point and the beach, the area of the Giniginámar latrines and the shower that works very well throughout the day without restrictions. Shower for feet x2 and for body, normal x1 and for the disabled x1. The only restaurant is about 100 mwtris away, Olas del Sur, although it does not open on Thursdays or Fridays. It has very few tables. The price list in several languages abroad. Highly recommended beach for snorkeling on the left near the cliff and for surfing on the right. There are no shops and the town is very, very quiet.

title: (35629) Tuineje - 22 Calle Palmeras
description: Large black sand beach with showers. Quiet place with wind.

title: (35580) Yaiza - 13 Calle Punta de Papagayo
description: Ample non-leveled dirt road very popular. Nearby restaurant and bar. No service but a wonderful beach

name: Camping Papagayo
title: (35580) Camping Papagayo
description: Little camping near to papagayo beach. It is relatively good protected form the wind. Lots of places available at any time. Showers and sinks available. Electricity and water also available.

title: (35580) Yaiza - Unnamed Road
description: Ample parking near the beach, without services. access by dirt road 5kms.

title: (35580) Yaiza - 1 Barrio Pechiguera
description: Large vacant lot around the lighthouse serving as a parking lot. We nibbled our snack there on the rocks facing the neighboring islands with the volcanoes just behind. Magnificent view, even to land in your vehicle, in case of bad weather. Quite a bit of passage but not too disturbing.

title: (35580) Yaiza - 2H Cl Rumania
description: Perfect parking to watch the sunset and spend the night without problem .. there are no services .. no garbage. beautiful in front of the sea

title: (35580) Yaiza - 140 Calle Monta/a Roja
description: Place spend the night and beaches

title: (35580) Playa Blanca - 3A Cl la Palma
description: It is an asphalt parking lot and at the end there is a dirt embankment. Right next to it there are some containers and also a small shopping center with a Spar supermarket. Ideal to be able to spend the night the night before taking the boat.

title: (35580) Yaiza - 176 Calle Monta/a Roja
description: Public parking.

title: (35580) Playa Blanca - 116 Calle del Chinchorro
description: Parking area to know the beautiful town and to spend the night and to embark the next day because it is next to the entrance to the port.

title: (35580) Yaiza - Unnamed Road
description: Right in front of the beach ...

title: (35580) Playa Blanca - 2A Cl Hierro el
description: Free parking and reasonably sheltered from the wind. Well located on the edge of the pedestrian avenue Maritima to make beautiful walks on the seafront. Beach and shops 5 minutes walk. We stayed 3 nights without worries. There were 2 other vans and 1 motorhome

title: (35580) Playa Blanca - 12 Calle de la Chalana
title_short: (35580) Playa Blanca - 12 Calle de la Chalana
description: Bus station 1.0 health center 1.1 papagayo 5.0 Only to stay if you are going to take the boat to Fuerteventura

title: (35580) Playa Blanca - 29 Calle San Sebastian
description: Quiet parking with beautiful sea views, possibility of walking to the beaches of Papagayo (about 10 minutes to get to beach women). lacks services.

title: (35580) Playa Blanca - 35 Calle las Maretas
description: Clean and very quiet laundry

title: (35580) Playa Blanca - 1A Calle Playa de Afre
title_short: (35580) Playa Blanca - 1A Calle Playa de Afre
description: Small free parking, mostly used by locals working in hotels. We stayed there 1 night because sheltered from the wind (more sheltered than the parking already referenced which is in height). Quiet night, the police came to the parking lot and then left (just a courteous round). 2 minutes from a small sheltered beach and access to the path that leads to Papagayo beaches. Rather for vans, not enough room for C.car.

title: (35580) Playa Blanca - 2 Cl San Sebastian
description: Excellent spot to stop without disturbing noises, shade during the day, spectacular sea view, bathrooms, supermarket and playground 100 meters away in the shopping center.

title: (35580) Playa Blanca - 2 Calle Monta/a Roja
description: Large dirt parking ideal for visiting Playa Blanca 5 min walk from the main promenade. very quiet at night

title: (35580) Playa Blanca - 22A Avenida de Papagayo
description: New parking lot, today on 06/26/2021 full of motorhomes, without services but close to everything, I do not know how long they will park there

title: (35629) Tarajalejo - 96 Urbanización Herbania
description: Discharge gray and black water

title: (35629) Tarajalejo - 14 Calle la Playa
description: You can park here too, which is closer to the showers on the beach, there is a hotel, the Ruis, but it is in a state of complete abandonment and everything is in decay

title: (35629) Tuineje - FV-2
description: Along the beach, to the right of the village. Shower  at the first aid station. Drainage area of chemical toilets in the village.  Free. No drainage of chemical toilets near this beach

title: (35570) Playa Blanca - Carr. Playa Blanca
description:
It is inside the "Clean Point".
It is a sewer with a lid where you can throw the Poti. They do not have a faucet to be able to rinse the Poti afterwards.
The sewer is behind some containers, so you cannot get in the motorhome to open the tap under it and empty the gray water. We throw away the gray water because we made an invention with a hose.
It's a bit sloppy but it's the only alternative we can find in the south of the island.

title: (35627) Pájara - FV-2
description: Drive as far as you can along the track and it's possible to park right on the beach on the harder sand. Safe beach for swimming. This is a very good place to fall asleep to the sound of the gentle waves.

title: (35570) Yaiza - Avenida Faro Pechiguera
description:
Abandoned hotel and natural pools.
This place is amazing for explorers! The huge abandoned Hotel complex from the 70s is private property, so entering it not legal, even though it's easily possible. The coast is high and rocky. If you climb down (people do it with their kids, so not very difficult) you find natural saltwater pools. It depends a bit on the tide if you can/want to swim. Best and safest is going right after high tide, when the water is fresh and clean. 
The road there is a dirt track with quite some stones and rocks. People go there with their regular rental cars, so it's probably doable with a van and a skilled driver. Careful with rain, as it gets very muddy.

title: (35627) Pájara - 7 FV-617
description: Large flat gravel site surrounded by palm trees, next to the Ermita las Hermosas and the sports field with views of the scattered courtyards and the sea. Behind the church playground, covered barbecue area with tables and benches. Hiking trail attached. Quiet. Street next door with little traffic.

title: (35627) Pájara - FV-2
description: Parking in the rocky beach area, good place for fishing and snorkeling if the weather permits

title: (35627) La Pared -
description: Magnificent spot by the sea you can also find natural swimming pools there, rough sea so be careful for swimming but possible! Accessible by car and van but a bit steep slope to leave

title: (35627) La Lajita - 37 Avenida Fragata
description: Small nice parking near the houses by the sea.

title: (35627) Pájara. La Lajita - 8 Calle Fragata
description: Very good camping place, the town has averithyng you could need, including a nice send beech.quiet.

title: (35627) Pájara - Unnamed Road
description: At the top of the cliffs 180 degree view of the ocean exposed to the wind in windy weather but when you wake up you are not disappointed

title: (35627) Pájara - FV-2
description: Free parking with stones beach. Good area to snorkel.

title: (35627) Pájara - Calle Piedras Negras
description: Natural pool on the wall, we have spent 2 nights and without any problem

title: (35627) Pájara -
description: Good beach to disconnect, rest, fish and enjoy. A little dazed from the wind.

title: (35570) Yaiza - 6 LZ-702
description: Parking at the exit of the city, ideal to spend a night with a sunset and an incredible view. The road passes right next to it but the view makes up for everything else! No convenience.

title: (35627) Pájara - 100 Avenida del Istmo
description: Spot on gravel ground, great views, great sunsets, 50 m to sandy beach.

title: (35570) Las Breñas -
description: No official car park but a good place to park and visit the natural baths in the rocks of the west coast. Access via an easily passable gravel road.

title: (35627) Pájara - 100 Avenida del Istmo
description: There are public toilets with running water (no drinking water!). There are great overnight parking spaces for campers nearby. You will have a great view here anyway.

title: (35570) Playa Quemada - 28 Caserio Playa Quemada
description: Spot for one van, mostly flat with beautiful sea view.

title: (35570) Femés - 44 Avenida a Femes
description: Parking at the edge of a path. Access by the village and a dirt road, easily accessible to medium-sized vehicles. Very exposed to the wind. Warning! do not try to climb higher in a vehicle, only accessible by 4x4. Nice hike of 2 hours to reach the antennas following the path. Above, incredible views of the volcanoes and surroundings. UNIQUE at this place.

title: (35570) Playa Quemada - 18 Caserio Playa Quemada
description: Nice and quiet place with many places to park. Many restaurants to eat on the beachfront. The entrance to the sea with many stones except for a couple of points where it is a little easier to enter for the bathroom. A beautiful beach of dark sand a little far to walk.

title: (35570) Yaiza - 4 Calle Garajonay
description: Open gravel parking lot. plenty of space between neighboring homes. great view to the ocean
